meanings.definition: An act of assessing something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's appraisals of the students' work helped them improve.
meanings.sent2: Real estate agents often conduct property appraisals to determine market value.
meanings.sent3: The appraisals of the cake's taste by the judges led to a tiebreaker.
meanings.sent4: Her appraisals of the situation were like a detective solving a mystery.
meanings.sent5: The appraisals of the artwork were so detailed, they could see every brushstroke.

meanings.definition: A judgment or evaluation of the worth or value of something.
meanings.sent1: His appraisals of antique furniture were always accurate.
meanings.sent2: The appraisals of the jewelry collection were higher than expected.
meanings.sent3: The appraisals of the dog's cuteness were off the charts.
meanings.sent4: Her appraisals of people's character were like reading a book.
meanings.sent5: The appraisals of the rare coin were so precise, they amazed collectors.

meanings.definition: A formal assessment or estimation of the value of property.
meanings.sent1: The bank required an appraisal of the house before approving the loan.
meanings.sent2: The appraisals of the land indicated a rise in value over time.
meanings.sent3: The appraisals of the car's condition were crucial for insurance purposes.
meanings.sent4: His appraisals of real estate were like predicting the future.
meanings.sent5: The appraisals of the historic building were so thorough, they uncovered hidden gems.
